freqshow_code package

Submodules

freqshow_code module

freqshow_code.controller module

class freqshow_code.controller.FreqShowController(model)

Bases: object

Class which controls the views shown in the application and mediates changing between views.

change_to_instant(*args)

Change to instantaneous spectrogram view.

change_to_main(*args)

Change to main spectrogram view (either instant or waterfall depending on what was the last main view).

change_to_settings(*args)

Change to settings list view.

change_to_waterfall(*args)

Change to waterfall spectrogram view.

change_view(view)

Change to specified view.

current()

Return current view.

message_dialog(text, **kwargs)

Open a message dialog which goes back to the previous view when canceled.

number_dialog(label_text, unit_text, **kwargs)

Open a number dialog which goes back to the previous view when canceled.

toggle_main(*args)

Switch between instantaneous and waterfall spectrogram views.

freqshow_code.freqshow module

freqshow_code.model module

class freqshow_code.model.FreqShowModel(width, height)

Bases: object

get_center_freq()

Return center frequency of tuner in megahertz.

get_data()

Get spectrogram data from the tuner. Will return width number of values which are the intensities of each frequency bucket (i.e. FFT of radio samples).

get_gain()

Return gain of tuner. Can be either the string ‘AUTO’ or a numeric value that is the gain in decibels.

get_max_string()

Return string with the appropriate maximum intensity value, either ‘AUTO’ or the min intensity in decibels (rounded to no decimals).

get_min_string()

Return string with the appropriate minimum intensity value, either ‘AUTO’ or the min intensity in decibels (rounded to no decimals).

get_sample_rate()

Return sample rate of tuner in megahertz.

set_center_freq(freq_mhz)

Set tuner center frequency to provided megahertz value.

set_gain(gain_db)

Set gain of tuner. Can be the string ‘AUTO’ for automatic gain or a numeric value in decibels for fixed gain.

set_max_intensity(intensity)

Set Y axis maximum intensity in decibels (i.e. dB value at top of spectrograms). Can also pass ‘AUTO’ to enable auto scaling of value.

set_min_intensity(intensity)

Set Y axis minimum intensity in decibels (i.e. dB value at bottom of spectrograms). Can also pass ‘AUTO’ to enable auto scaling of value.

set_sample_rate(sample_rate_mhz)

Set tuner sample rate to provided frequency in megahertz.

freqshow_code.ui module

class freqshow_code.ui.Button(rect, text, click=None, font_size=None, bg_color=None)

Bases: object

bg_color = (60, 60, 60, 0)
border_color = (200, 200, 200)
border_px = 2
click(location)

Click handler will fire the button’s click handler if the provided location x, y tuple is inside the button.

fg_color = (255, 255, 255)
font_size = 33
padding_px = 2
render(screen)

Render the button on the provided surface.

class freqshow_code.ui.ButtonGrid(width, height, cols, rows)

Bases: object

add(col, row, text, rowspan=1, colspan=1, **kwargs)

Add a Button to the grid at the specified row and col position in the grid. Row and col are 0-based indexes. Buttons can span multiple rows and columns by providing optional rowspan and colspan parameters. Any other keyword arguments are passed to the Button constructor.

click(location)

Handle click events at the provided location tuple (x, y) for all the buttons.

render(screen)

Render buttons on the provided surface.

freqshow_code.ui.align(child, parent, horizontal=0.5, vertical=0.5, hpad=300, vpad=0)

Return tuple of x, y coordinates to render the provided child rect aligned inside the parent rect using the provided horizontal and vertical alignment. Each alignment value can be ALIGN_LEFT, ALIGNT_TOP, ALIGN_CENTER, ALIGN_RIGHT, or ALIGN_BOTTOM. Can also specify optional horizontal padding (hpad) and vertical padding (vpad).

freqshow_code.ui.get_font(size)

Get font of the specified size. Will cache fonts internally for faster repeated access to them.

freqshow_code.ui.render_text(text, size=33, fg=(255, 255, 255), bg=(0, 0, 0))

Render the provided text to a surface which is returned.

class freqshow_code.views.ViewBase

Bases: object

Base class for simple UI view which represents all the elements drawn on the screen. Subclasses should override the render, and click functions.

click(location)
render(screen)
class freqshow_code.views.WaterfallSpectrogram(model, controller)

Bases: SpectrogramBase

Scrolling waterfall plot of spectrogram data.

clear_waterfall()
render_spectrogram(screen)

Subclass should implement spectorgram rendering in the provided surface.

freqshow_code.views.clamp(x, x0, x1)

Clamp a provided value to be between x0 and x1 (inclusive). If value is outside the range it will be truncated to the min/max value which is closest.

freqshow_code.views.gradient_func(colors)

Build a waterfall color function from a list of RGB color tuples. The returned function will take a numeric value from 0 to 1 and return a color interpolated across the gradient of provided RGB colors.

freqshow_code.views.lerp(x, x0, x1, y0, y1)

Linear interpolation of value y given min and max y values (y0 and y1), min and max x values (x0 and x1), and x value.

freqshow_code.views.rgb_lerp(x, x0, x1, c0, c1)

Linear interpolation of RGB color tuple c0 and c1.
